signals.ai_reasoning: Extreme oversold RSI strengthens the bullish case. While a strong reversal is possible, the extremely high volatility adds considerable risk, but also potential reward. Timing could be good for a contrarian play.
RSI at 10 is extremely oversold, suggesting a potential bounce. Actionable for a short-term long position, but needs confirmation. High volatility increases risk.
Stochastic oscillator in oversold territory supports the bullish reversal case. K value of 1.3 strengthens the oversold signal. Good timing but needs volume confirmation.
Williams %R also confirms oversold conditions, adding weight to the potential reversal. Similar considerations to RSI and Stochastic, but slightly less reliable historically.

Wide range day confirms high volatility and indecision in the market. It is hard to act on this signal alone, but it underlines the need for caution and tight stop-loss orders. Can create opportunity but also increases the chance of stop-loss hunting.

High volatility makes trading inherently riskier. This signal is a reminder to reduce position sizes and use wider stop losses. Also opens the potential for greater profit if the trade goes the correct way.
Lower low reinforces the bearish trend. This signal on its own is not actionable, but adds bearish pressure and reduces the probability of a sustained bounce based purely on oversold indicators.

Strong bearish candle supports the short-term bearish outlook. While oversold, a strong bearish candle suggests the selling pressure is still dominant. Best to avoid counter-trend positions until the candle formations changes.

Falling OBV confirms the selling pressure and weakens the bullish RSI signals. Not a strong signal on its own, but acts as a warning sign against aggressive long positions. Suggests the current downtrend may have further to run.
Extreme volatility makes precision trading difficult. Expect large swings and potential for false breakouts. Trade with caution and only if you are comfortable with the increased risk profile.
Large loss indicates strong bearish momentum. While oversold conditions exist, this signal suggests a continuation of the downtrend. High risk to counter-trade this.
Weak 20-day momentum indicates a sustained downtrend. This is a strong bearish signal and suggests the bounce will be weak, if any. Counter-trend trades are extremely risky in this scenario.

top_signal_info.why: Extreme Oversold RSI presents the best contrarian opportunity, despite the inherent risks with high volatility. Requires careful position sizing and risk management. High risk, high potential reward setup.
